validate-commit-msg.helpMessage:
Please fix your commit message (consider using 'npm i -g commitizen'). Well-formatted commit messages allow us to automate our changelog and npm releases.

Examples:
"fix(copy-view): Fixed an error when resolving paths for view directories"
"feat(gcc): Added support for defines"

If you have installed commitizen, try running 'git cz'.

scripts.package:update: if git diff --name-only ORIG_HEAD HEAD | grep --quiet package.json; then npm update && npm install; fi
scripts.test: for i in src/main/xsd/*/*/*.xsd; do xmllint $i > out.log && echo "valid XSD: $i" || (echo "bad XSD: $i"; exit 1); done
